required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ventilation Strategy During General Anesthesia for Orthopedic Surgery
clinical_study.official_title: Ventilation Strategy During General Anesthesia for Orthopedic Surgery

brief_summary.textblock: The objective is to determine the optimal intraoperative ventilation strategy among the chosen tidal volume and positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEP) levels, and standardize it in an enhanced recovery pathway for orthopedic surgical patients. In particular, we propose to determine which combination of intraoperative tidal volume and positive end-expiratory pressure is best for patients having elective orthopedic surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a non-randomized alternating intervention cohort study in which all orthopedic surgery operating rooms will alternate amongst four designated ventilation settings which include two tidal volumes and two PEEP levels. At the end of the four-week sequence, the entire sequence will be repeated 26 times over a 2-year period. Thus, ventilator settings will not be randomized on a per-patient basis, or even among study weeks.
Ventilation parameters will be designated at the beginning of each study week. However, clinicians will be free to adjust to whatever ventilation settings they believe is optimal in individual patients to ensure oxygenation and patient safety.

primary_outcome.measure: Time-weighted average SaO2/FiO2 ratio in the postanesthesia care unit (PACU)
primary_outcome.time_frame: After surgery until discharged from PACU or up to 90 minutes
primary_outcome.description: Arterial oxygen saturation (SaO2) is monitored continuously in in the PACU by pulse oximetry.inspired oxygen fraction (FiO2) will be estimated from the type of device and the oxygen flow rate, using the following conversion table below. We will assume that the FiO2 remains at the same level until the time of next record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Composite of serious postoperative pulmonary complications
secondary_outcome.description: Postoperative diagnoses will be collected from electronic medical records of patients. Individual chart reviews (blinded to ventilation management) will confirm that terms of the composite are met will be performed.

secondary_outcome.measure: Oxygenation in ward, defined as SaO2/FIO2 ratio
secondary_outcome.description: Oxygen administration and SaO2 are normally recorded at 4-hour intervals on surgical wards. The overall of SaO2/FIO2 will be compared among different ventilation strategies.

other_outcome.time_frame: After surgery until discharged from the hospital
other_outcome.description: Time from extubation to first oxygen saturation on ambient air breathing.
Intraoperative estimated blood loss and perioperative transfusions.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Low tidal volume and low PEEP
arm_group.description: Ventilation parameters will be set at tidal volume = 6 ml/ kg predicted body weight, and PEEP = 5 cm water (H2O).

arm_group.arm_group_label: Low tidal volume and high PEEP
arm_group.description: Ventilation parameters will be set at tidal volume = 6 ml/kg predicted body weight, and PEEP = 8 cm H2O.

arm_group.arm_group_label: High tidal volume and low PEEP
arm_group.description: Ventilation parameters will be set at tidal volume = 10 ml/kg predicted body weight, and PEEP = 5cm H2O.

arm_group.arm_group_label: High tidal volume and high PEEP
arm_group.description: Ventilation parameters will be set at tidal volume = 10 ml/kg predicted body weight, and PEEP = 8cm H2O.

intervention.description: Tidal volume = 6 ml/kg predicted body weight
intervention.arm_group_label: Low tidal volume and high PEEP
Low tidal volume and low PEEP

intervention.description: Tidal volume = 10 ml/kg predicted body weight
intervention.arm_group_label: High tidal volume and high PEEP
High tidal volume and low PEEP
High tidal volume and low PEEP
Low tidal volume and low PEEP
High tidal volume and high PEEP
Low tidal volume and high PEEP

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Surgery in orthopedic operating rooms 32-37
- General anesthesia with endotracheal intubation.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non-orthopedic procedures;
- Intubation before induction of anesthesia.

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be shared on a collaborative basis.
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: After publication of the primary manuscript.
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Data will be shared on a collaborative basis with investigators who plan substantive sub-analyses.
